column4: I thought ubuntu was a debian?
no, only debian is debian
Ok I see... ;)
ubuntu will have different library versions than debian. dependencies will break. some scripts won't work
it totally depends on the problem

When i launch my computer, gnome won't start anymore, I do'nt have any gui, just a terminal logon promt. When I log on, and try to start X, it raises an error. Smame goes when I try to start nautilus or kde.
you used to have gdm? the graphical login?
I used to have gdm, the grapgical login
well, X is broken somehow. try to reconfigure it with dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
what kind of error messages do you get? X errors also leave logs in /var/log
So basically I should logon ithout the gui, and do "sudo  dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg"
I'm not sure how to get to /var/log without the gui :s
yeah, if you don't want to read the logs and find out what exactly is wrong :)
cd /var/log. list the files with ls, read them with less
i'll look what the exact log file is, hold on
Ok. What is less? a terminal based text reader?
probably /var/log/Xorg.0.log has the most recent errors
yes, less is a pager for long files and command outputs
I'm using a live session, I'll try that, than I'll come back to tell what errors I've read... thanx
not to you it isn't =)
yeah, and scroll down untill you find errors
I'm using a live session, I'll try that, than I'll come back to tell what errors I've read... thanx
